definition: Yan Zhenqing (709-785), a leading calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty
color/face/countenance
surname Yan
really/truly/indeed/real/true/genuine
high ranking official (old)/term of endearment between spouses (old)/(from the Tang Dynasty onwards) term used by the emperor for his subjects (old)/honorific (old)

sentences.english: The period's representative calligrapher was Yan Zhenqing.
This is a letter Yen Chenching wrote to a friend.
sentences.chinese: 這是顏真卿寫給友人的書信。

sentences.english: The formation of Yan Zhenqing's calligraphy made the regular script considerable development in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 顏真卿書法藝術形成，使唐楷得到長足發展。

sentences.english: Yan lived in a poor family when he was young and had to practice calligraphy on the wall by using mud.
sentences.chinese: 顏真卿少時家貧缺紙筆，用筆醮黃土水在牆上練字。

sentences.english: This inscription was written by Yan Zhenqing, the great calligrapher of the Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 這個碑銘出自唐代大書法家顏真卿的手筆。

definition: Liu Gongquan (778-865), Tang calligrapher

Yang Ningshi (873-954) calligrapher of 5 dynasties period between Tang and Song
Zhong Yao (151-230), minister of Cao Wei 曹魏[Cao2 Wei4] and noted calligrapher, said to have developed the regular script 楷書|楷书[kai3 shu1]

great calligraphy master/the Sage of Calligraphy, traditional reference to Wang Xizhi 王羲之[Wang2 Xi1 zhi1] (303-361)

Huangting Jing, one of the primary scriptures of Daoism
Lu Ji (261-303), Chinese writer and literary critic
regular script (Chinese calligraphic style)
